title: Decent app but could be improved
text:
This app does the job well, however I'd like to mention that the humidity indicator made me buy a dehumidifier first and then a humidifier, since every other bar for Awair Glow C is "the more the worse". Turned out that humidity must be between 40 and 60 per cent, and mine was too low instead of being too high. Not a big deal, but a good example of how bad UI/UX decisions can cost users money.
Aside from that I'd improve navigation for historical data, it's often not easy to understand where on the timeline you are.

title: Learned Important data affecting my health
text:
The Awair device and app are fantastic. I’ve had it for a few weeks now and it’s helped me uncover that my bedroom CO2 levels were getting too high at night. I’ve been sleeping better since learning to leave the door open. Last night with the cold weather I broke out the humidifier and I discovered that my humidifier was spewing huge amounts of dust (pm) in the air and needed more thorough cleaning. The app made it easy to see the correlation between humidity and the PM increase. 

Thank you Awair team! It’s still early days in market for these kinds of home air sensors and I’m excited for what you do from here.

One more thing, if anyone is shopping around ... I previously had tried Flow from PlumeLabs but the app and overall setup was too frustrating so I returned it. The Awair is much better user experience.  Unless you really need a portable sensor like the Flow, stick with the Awair. It’s also not as big as it looks on the web site and it’s as stylish as you could imagine for an air sensor ;)

title: Peace of mind when working from home
text:
Now that I'm working from home full time like many of us, I was concerned about the air quality in my home office. This device helped me to immediately diagnose the issues with my air quality and I've seen the immediate results of taking steps to improve it (cracking open a window when CO2 is too high, getting a humidifier to combat the dry desert climate, etc).

The device looks great and the display on the device itself is pretty easy to understand once you get used to what each of the bars means. I also like how the display can be adjusted to show any of the metrics individually or can be used as a simple clock if desired. I also appreciate the light level adjustment and the sleep mode which would come in handy if using the device in a bedroom.

Additionally, I've found the mobile software to be top notch. I like being able to track trends over time and see the impact of my actions in graph form. Unlike others here I personally haven't had any issues keeping it connected to WiFi, though I understand that would be frustrating.

All in all, if you're spending more time at home lately and are concerned about your air quality, I'd highly recommend this!

title: Knowing Your Air is Amazing!
text:
What’s better than knowing how are you doing with your indoor air? I recently noticed having a dry air and low humidity and I was receiving all the tips and notifications from Awair about it, I didn’t think it will affect my health until I got a severe cough for two weeks, and my doctor told me it’s from dry air, and that I need a humidifier. 

Short story long, Awair App told me right away, so for future I’ll be able to take a better care of my health by knowing my air.

title: UX in the app needs improvement
text: I should not have to delete my devices, factory reset, and then add them again just to change my WiFi. Additionally, when clicking the WiFi in the app, it shouldn’t take me to a support page. It should take me to the WiFi settings and allow me to make changes from there. Poor UX on both of these areas. I hope you update and fix these as it seems a poor design aspect.

title: Broke It
text: I have two first generation Awair systems that I had purchased a year apart and then they pushed a firmware update that I had no control over that broke the light adjustment that is supposed to adjust depending on the ambient light in the room. After months of working and communicating with them they told me it’s rare but we’re happy if you pay for an upgrade to our newer system that doesn’t have this problem. They broke two of my products that I paid $400 dollars for. Not me. They are responsible. Not me. Yet they told me the only way to fix it is to buy their newest product. Totally not acceptable and typical of companies nowadays. Take no responsibility and make the consumer pay for their mistakes. Total BS.

title: This is my new obsession.
text:
I love the app, but it would be fantastic if you could pinch to zoom on the graphs to be able to get more minutia detail on exactly when something happened that affected the air quality. 

I love the Awair Glow I think I got, which is just the wall plug that sits and monitors the air and gives you alerts. 

Does it work as a carbon monoxide alarm too? If not, it should. It definitely is much easier to setup and maintain than a regular smoke alarm.

title: Good, but notifications are a little much
text:
Overall this is a pretty good app. Notifications are either on or off for the various air quality metrics. It would be ideal if I could choose how Awair notifies me. For example, I only want to be notified when air quality goes down, not when it goes back up. Just notify me on actionable quality changes. 

Great product overall. App needs just a bit of work.

title: Incredibly difficult to change WiFi networks
text:
Was using at home and spent a day trying to get it onto a different WiFi than during original setup. Instead of being able to configure which network it is on, clicking the button in the app to troubleshoot the network sends you to a useless help page. There should be a button on the app for Bluetooth to tell the unit to change networks. Ran into the same issue when I took the unit from home to my work office.

The data provided though is useful.

title: Decent app terrible hardware reliability
text:
The app is reasonably polished although the tips are repetitive and the indoor humidity score doesn’t factor in outdoor temp.  For example when my outdoor temp is -20 F I can’t have an indoor humidity over 40% without having condensation on my window.

The real problem though is hardware quality.  My first Awair 2nd gen had a LED that was out my replacement lasted less than 2 months before the internal fan going out and causing a nasty grinding noise.  I’m giving up due to 2 duds.

I just purchased the laser egg 2+ and hope it’s more reliable.

title: Really great for working from home
text: I work from home and using Awair has done wonders helping me ensure that I’m breathing healthy air. I got the Element to get a read on CO2 levels in my office and am able to maintain a much healthier balance, now knowing when to open a window and increase ventilation. Highly recommend!

title: It works
text: I feel that 3* is unfair rating. The app(and devices) works fine. Yes, as everything there is room for improvement but nothing really broken: UI is clean, sync happens, couple reported issues were fixed over time. So, good product, please continue,

title: AQI vs. Awair score
text:
App seems to work very well.  No issues with setup or WiFi so far but only 2 days experience.

Main beef is that there is no option to have the app report the standard AQI score (lower is better) in the app or charts rather than the Awair score (higher is better).  The only place I can see my indoor AQI score is on the Outdoor map at the bottom left.   So
Apples/oranges situation- no way to relate.

As others have reported it would be nice to be able to manage the various alert levels.

Also was unable to log in to the web portal- have reported this to Awair.  Enter email and password but Continue button is always grayed out.

title: Mostly reliable with some issues
text: Overall the app is informative and reliable with some infrequent wifi interruptions with gaps in data reporting. Biggest issue is integration with smart thermostat. Worked well for awhile then stopped linking fan operation to CO2 parameters. Could not get it to work so gave up. Then it  worked for a random week and stopped again.

title: Yay, widgets!
text:
Love the addition of proper iOS 14 widgets. It’d be great if we could have a couple themes, like perhaps a dark and light widget where your only your score is highlighted as green/yellow/red rather than the entire widget background. A giant, bright green widget is a bit much on my home screen!

Keep up the good work!

title: Good, but...
text: This is one of far too many apps that aren’t native to iOS. That means they don’t support any of the things you would expect a good platform citizen to support, such as HomeKit, or watch complications, or widgets. The list goes on. Because they cut corners on the app, it diminishes the whole experience of using the product.

title: Works as it should
text: Easy review. App does what it’s supposed to do. Easy as that. Works with PlanetWatch with your Type 4 License. Pairs easily with Awair and let’s you change settings easily. You can turn off notifications. I have mine set to allergies. 5 Stars.

title: Great device
text:
One suggestion. 
When looking at the temp history, it would be helpful to overlay the historic outside temp as well. We placed the device in a room we’re remodeling and as we add insulation it’s neat to see the temperature over time. It would be helpful though to see the trend with the outside temp as well.

title: Useful data but frequent disconnections.
text:
The Awair Air Monitor combined with this app is a great way to be awair of your air conditions. The app is well polished and the data seems quite accurate, compared with another similar monitor. 

However, during the last 2 weeks I have experienced too many frequent disconnections from Awair server. In most of the cases these last for many hours both during the night and day.

title: Nice device, app needs work
text:
The data from the device is great and is changing how I allow air to flow into my apartment.   Long term, this product will be great, but the app needs work.  

-iPad display is terrible, an iPad specific version or compatibility is badly needed
-notifications are too frequent and not very useful
-device lighting should dim or shut off dependent upon your sleep schedule, the device is way too bright for a bedroom
-allow for user created alert thresholds

Overall an enjoyable and useful product that feels a like a beta version software wise.

title: Nice but lacking
text: The main reason I bought this was to control my humidifier for my houseplants. Unfortunately the app won’t let you set the humidity above 45%. Ideally I’d set it at 60%. This would be an easy fix so I’m hoping they make the change. Otherwise it’s a great little app and the air quality monitoring is a fun feature.

title: Great app, even better support
text: Just have to say that the Awair team are amazing and will happily help you with anything you may need.  The app works perfectly and the design is nicely done as well.

title: Widget kinda broken with latest update
text: Have to check the boxes under settings for which Awair devices to show on the widget, even though they always showed without issue before latest update and without using this setting

title: Widget fixed!
text:
Five stars now they the widget is fixed 😃

Would have given the app 5 stars, but the widget stopped working after the last update. Now, there's no easy way to look at my air quality.

title: Great app / annoying upsell
text:
I've been using Awair Glow and now the Element, both are great devices for my needs.

However in the recent months, the nagging upsell to Awair business is just as bad as Nest.

Please, I get it, there is business version - but I don't want it. Consider snoozing or removing the upsell notice. When I want to check my devices, I don't want to keep clicking through upsell screens.

It's funny for Awair, because when people ask me about the devices, I say they are great but the software is terrible with the constant upsell.

Kindly address please.

title: Reset to change WIFI
text: I thought this would be great for travel but you can’t just switch wifi - you have to start from scratch and you lose your history.

title: Simple and functional
text: It works well, shares good data and the technology has improved.  It’s easy to set up.

title: BUGGY - PLEASE FIX
text: With one device the app is okay. With multiple devices the app is crazy buggy. Says all the Awair elements are disconnected, even after refreshing. Then after about 5 minutes they’ll all connect for a short period of time then disconnect again.

title: Great device, app has issues
text: Love my Awair.  One issue, I linked the device with my Nest.  My thermostat was then kicking off the fan every few seconds and it was running continuously.  After unlinking the thermostat the fan is back to normal.  Expensive electric bill heading my way...

title: Sometimes reliable
text: Set up with this app is ridiculously difficult and frequently just simply does not work. It’s disappointing because this is a great idea and a very needed technology and doing something like writing software that actually can detect a Wi-Fi signal seems incredibly difficult for this team. It’s been on the market for a long time so the excuses are wearing thin

title: HomeKit
text: Would love each sensor in our Awair to show up in HomeKit for added accessibility to the Awair’s data and the ability to automate parts of our home off of that data.

title: Needs zoom
text:
Why can’t I zoom! 

I am trying to get my neighbor kicked out for smoking against his lease. I need to zoom so his activity doesn’t look like a single pixel of disobedience.

title: Lack of Google home integration
text: Would be great to have measurements available in Google Home. Currently you have to ask Assistant for them

title: dark mode
text: please add dark mode when I check at night it blinds me even with brightness all the way down. thank you!

title: App is awesome! Hardware is decent.
text: App has a lot of features.  They need an iPad version. 2nd gen device is good. The Glow C device lacks CO2 which is disappointing, but still a cool little device.

title: Dark mode? Seriously?!
text: Who cares about dark mode?! I’ve been waiting years and years for a VERY simple setting of preferred temperature range and they said it was coming but has not come. Why?! It’s so simple! This would make the Awair score actually useful but right now it is useless :/

title: Helpful during CA fires
text: The app gives very useful info to make informed decisions. Love the app and device. Please add an app for Apple Watch.

title: Gender and age questions?!
text: The app is fine as well as the product. Not sure why it needs to know my gender and age.

title: Air trigger on and off repeatedly right at the reached point.
text: It should be a range not a point for level to kick on or off air trigger. So air trigger may not be repeatedly on and off right at the point.

title: Barely works.
text: I have 3 Awairs which used to be great. Now, over the past few months, Awair’s servers are degrading and the app fails to load metrics 80% of the time. Worse, if also fails to trigger automations. Until this is fixed, pass on Awair. Their quality is really bad.

title: The new widgets are awful
text: Did nobody test this? It’s horrendous looking. They could have just copied the old widgets and it would have been much better. Nobody wants to see a giant streak of bright green or red on their Home Screen.

title: Tend Zooming
text: Excellent app and in order to make it better, I would recommend to have zooming ability in the trend.

title: Stopped working
text:
App stopped working, staying to check my internet connection which is working fine.
Delegated app and did a new reinstall, same results. Device is working fine in bedroom.

title: Terrible
text: For the price you’d think you’d get a product that had consistent connectivity.  Always drops of the network and I can’t even log into the app anymore.  Waste of money, don’t buy!!!

title: Good devices bad software
text: The devices are awesome it’s just with this latest update it doesn’t work with Google Home and the latest IOS

title: Glitchy
text: It works until it doesn't. Which is a lot. In fact you can count on it not to display your monitor(s) more often than not. This app needs some stability.

title: Leaves a lot to be desired
text: The screen shots make it seem like it would be great, but it leaves a lot to be desired. Slow, constant “failure” messages, and even forgot the Awair Element I added.

title: Crash in the onboarding flow prevents device setup
text: Bought the Glow C but it’s a brick until the onboarding crash (iOS 13.2) is fixed. Awful that basic flows like onboarding have a crash in an unskipable step. Lack of basic attention to detail.

title: Latest version crash
text:
Unable to add devices with latest version.
Tried on multiple devices, all crash when you click find button.
Improve testing process.

title: App doesn’t work
text: When opening it had a blank screen. I reinstalled and now it won’t login giving me the ‘unknown error 404’. I now own a paperweight that provides a general sense of what the air is like. Useless.

title: Please add Homekit support?
text: How about a little Apple user love and add Homekit support?  Love the devices and love the app!  Just needs a little bit more comparability with Homekit and then it’s a 100% device!

title: Terrible
text:
iPads are primarily used in landscape mode and you have zero support for landscape mode. 

There are over 800 million iPads and most are used in landscape mode due to comfort on your lap or bed, prevalent case design, or keyboards.

No dark mode support

title: Massively inaccurate
text: Shows huge temp/humidity/quality swings within a matter of minutes, then rebounds back. No way this is happening in reality. Sadly, this thing is just an expensive night light.

title: Crashes often
text: App crashes after a few seconds of being open on  IPhone x ios 11. App still usable but quite frustrating to keep restarting it.

title: App doesn’t work
text:
Literally had this piece of garbage for a year before the company apparently decided to turn off their servers, leaving me with a brick.  

This is why these cloud-oriented hardware companies are total rackets.

title: Last update
text: Stop working after last update. Server not available very often.

title: Useful app but UX could be better
text:
The app provides a good basic overview of current and history data. It’d be 5/5 for me if the UX was a bit more refined. 

Eg.:
-Cannot “stretch” graphs
-App doesn’t remember last graph visible
-Cannot set alerts for specific thresholds

title: Internal server error
text: Any suggestions how to deal with that? I just got mine.

title: U guys need to update this
text: Like seriously I can get connected to the Wifi, but this silly personalization step that is the 3rd step is broken. Cmon guys it’s really frustrating.

title: Update breaks all features
text: No devices shown, crashing all over the place, terrible experience.

title: Y-axis on the Charts
text: The app is fine otherwise, just please put a Y-axis on the charts?

title: Buggy app
text: Until this release, the app has been pretty good. The current app frequently crashes making it unusable

title: Bad Software
text: Slow, and full of bugs.

title: App crashes
text: App crashes every time I try to look back at the week trend. Didn’t used to have this problem.

title: Unattractive widget
text: The new widget is a really bright green and quite the eyesore. I preferred the old one.

title: Gotta love the dark mode!
text: Very nice!

title: Doesn’t use Sign In With Apple
text: All apps are required to use Sign In With Apple for privacy reasons, this doesn’t.

title: Not a bad app
text: Although It crashes now whenever I click trends.

title: App crashes during setup
text: I just got the Awair 2 but can’t set it up since the app just crashes.

title: Fix the Widget
text: The new update broke the widget. It now just says “unable to load” 😑

title: Landscape Fail
text: Could use with iPad if you'd allow the app to work in landscape mode.

title: On-going issues with Nest Integration
text: On-going issues with Nest Integration have not been addressed by Awair support.

title: Bob Duggan
text: Useless app with a useless product. No phone support. Go with IQ Air monitor or Blueair Aware

title: Theoretically good product
text:
I received the Awair plug in as a gift and I was ecstatic. However the more I used it the less excited I was. The main reason I use this is to monitor air quality in the room with my bird, frankly the concept is game changing. 
My biggest issues are 
1. Triggers for notifications are arbitrary. I'm notified it's cold, well no not really I think it's fine. Same thing with humidity, I'm told it's too moist and mold will grow. I keep it intentionally humid (for the bird). If settings can exist for "baby" or "productivity" etc it seems I should be able to have a custom threshold. 
2. The trigger for the plug doesn't really work. I've tried 4 different items and unless those items are configured in a particular way they don't kick on. I bought a fancy air purifier, it doesn't power on with the trigger at all. 
3. There used to be a usage indicator for the plug, then it got removed for no reason. I inquired about it and was told it was just removed and "the awair uses xx amount of energy" not really an answer, but okay. I would like to track how much energy is used by an item plugged into the awair. A $15 smart plug can do this surely this feature can be reenabled. 
Overall it's a good start but the app needs to be more robust to really tap into the potential for the product.

title: Great app great product
text: I'm a freak about air I breath and this thing has done wonders giving me the information I need to make informed decisions the app is very simple and easy to use as well understand the cards it displays are very useful and helpful making decisions on what needs to be done. The updates have been great no glitches no frozen app it's all good and so is the device it's connected to I can't say anything bad about either and having a child it's important to me to know quality of air in my home even if I'm not there

title: Great Start
text:
Overall I really like this app, but am looking forward to some new additions. As others have pointed out, weekly charts are the most desired. I'd also like to see a widget and possibly a Apple Watch app with a complication for air quality. That would be ideal.

The knocking feature seems inconsistent. I'd rather see the LEDs only light up fully when the air quality falls to orange or below. When everything is green, there's not much to look at and it's more sleek that way.

Great job on the overall design, but looking forward to a few more features.

title: Great device, app needs some tweaks
text:
Six months in, I still like my Awair Glow. There are a few things that I hope are resolved:

1. As of April 2017, Glow still does not support IFTTT recipes like the original Awair.

2. Awair+ triggers need to be refined. For example, if the humidity limit is set at 40%, your humidifier will constantly turn on and off as the room humidity vacillates from 39% to 40% and back to 39%. Sometimes as frequently as once a minute in a dry room. Setting a range for the triggers could fix this.

title: Night light is right...
text: This is a $200 bright light you can’t turn off. Sure there’s settings to turn off the night light and turn down the brightness, except the light stays on without motion and turns itself all the way up. The settings reset to on and full bright almost immediately. With this is my bedroom I can’t tell you how many times it’s woken me up. If this device did more than warn me about humidity throughout the day, it might be worth unplugging for bed and replugging in the morning. Instead it’s a $200 reminder that startup tech is buggy and usually not worth the money

title: I love mine
text: For a brand new product, this thing delivers. Mine had some dust reading problems but a quick blast of compressed air cleaned the sensor. The value this adds to my life is immense. When I don't know why I'm getting frustrated and Awair suddenly tells me to open a window, I'm delighted that this thing has my back.

title: Good app, device is upredictable
text: The app functions well. The device seems to get random reading. It bounces between a score of 60-90 within a matter of minutes, and  when nothing has seemingly changed. I can put it in a sealed box and it jumps in score randomly

title: Great product, great app, great air
text: I love this monitor! Thanks Awair for helping m improve and manage my air quality. I love the ability to look back at 4 weeks of data now!!!

title: I own Four Awair Meters
text: I have a love hate relationship with having more than one device. Though there are MANY things I love about it. Though my current gripe (hopefully a temporary one) is unforgivable till fixed. The application crashes every time I attempt to look at a trend when using a iPhone 6S Plus.

title: Stay away
text: Awair Glow has been nothing but issues. Still can't connect to the "Awair server" even after going through all of their ridiculous troubleshooting steps. Range seems to be a huge problem. Buy with extreme caution, lots of users reporting the same issues.

title: Fix the clock
text: I have two awairs and the clock function screws up at least 2-3 times a month showing the wrong time. This is really annoying and disappointing considering these are super expensive and it seems like syncing with a time server is a trivial thing.

title: Lovin it!
text: Easy to use! Simple and to the point!

title: The Awair is doing great. Love it.
text: The Awair had an issue with wireless connectivity.  Support sent me a new unit and it's working great.

title: Immediately crashes on iOS 10
text: Immediately crashes on load now after update to iOS 10.. did not test update apparently?

title: Feels incomplete
text:
I purchased the new Awair Glow and have used it with the app for about 2 weeks now. The app by itself leaves a lot to be desired. I had installed a competitor product at my mother's place and that app is so much more informative. This app was very confusing to me when I first turned it on. It's winter and it's 70° in my apartment which, to me, is very comfortable. The app was giving me an Orange indicator. Why? Which direction does my temperature need to go in? Same with humidity. I grew up in the desert so humidity was never a thought of mine until I go somewhere like New Orleans. So it's 30% humidity, now what? Is it too humid, not humid enough? The CO2 and VOCs seems simple enough, less is better… I think. My mothers app told us what was optimal and had information like CO2 at 1000ppm can make you sleepy and what a normal range should be. This app has none of that. Your best bet is to find green by going one direction or another and try your best to stay inside that range. Another issue is that the Awair team has a medium blog with information like sleeping is optimal at 65° but the app doesn't mirror that and will give you a orange indicator even though I have told the app to optimize for sleep. (Can choose general, sleep, productivity, allergies, and babies as optimization settings). 

So long story short, the app is a good first attempt. Luckily the product seems to work well so far and an app update should make this app the awesome product it should be.  

Side note, the other review was about the app crashing. I had the same issue and asked for help on twitter, they had me delete and re-download the app. This fixed nothing as I was now unable to reach the login server. Later in the day that was fixed but Awair never acknowledged that was their mistake and insinuated it was my end which it clearly wasn't.

title: All beauty, no brains
text:
Network functionality absolutely blows. This thing could only connect to a network extender a foot away. It couldn't connect to other recognized networks at all. 

Don't waste your money.

title: Keeps crashing when click trend
text: It’s been like this for a while and they still aren’t able to fix it...

title: Disappointing
text: The sensors are not calibrated and inaccurate. If you place 5 sensors right next to each other they will all display wildly different readings.

title: finally updated
text: this updated version is really awesome! finally the awair is flawless. good job

title: Won't let me register
text: Waited for half an hour but it will not send me a confirmation email. Now the box is useless

title: App crashes
text: Cannot access the trend charts. Crashes every time.

title: App is disaster
text:
I can’t even create my account with email with domain @pm.me shorthand form @protonmail.com
Horrible experience

title: More days for data, please!
text: Many users need it, hear them already

title: No iPad support
text: I like the app on my iPhone, but there is no landscape mode on the iPad. How hard is it to provide an iPad version? Right now it feel like poor android app.

title: Won't allow new user to create account
text:
After downloading the app, an "Unauthorized" messages appears after attempting to create an account. Followed password requirements and have a compatible device (iPhone 6S Plus with latest software)

I then created an account on the website, then followed email confirmation, and when I try to login in the app it says to check that username and password are correct, which they are correct. Tried to reset password through app and says no account found. Just purchased the device but can't use it as I cannot login into the app.
